title: Quiz 7: Health Promotion Approaches
topicName: Principles & Practice of Health Promotion I
description: Evaluate understanding of the various approaches to health promotion, from medical to social change.

questions.question: Match the Level of Prevention (Medical Approach) with its example:
questions.explanation: Primary = Prevention; Secondary = Screening/Early Tx; Tertiary = Rehab/Management.
questions.hint: Think about the timing: Before, During (Early), or After disease.

questions.question: Which approach assumes that increasing people's knowledge will lead to healthier behavior?
questions.explanation: The educational approach focuses on providing knowledge and information, assuming this drives behavior change.

questions.question: Which approach aims to make 'the healthier choice the easier choice' by changing the physical/social environment?
questions.explanation: Social change focuses on policy and environment to facilitate healthy choices for everyone.
questions.hint: It changes society, not just the person.

questions.question: What are the common criticisms of the Behavior Change approach? (Select all that apply)

options.text: It is unable to target major socio-economic causes
It assumes a direct link between knowledge and behavior
It empowers the community too much

questions.explanation: Critics argue it blames the victim, ignores root causes (socio-economic), and assumes knowledge equals action.
questions.hint: Does knowing smoking is bad always stop people from smoking?

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ approach uses the influence of friends and similar age groups to promote positive health behavior.
questions.explanation: Peer-to-peer education relies on the credibility and influence of peers.

questions.question: The Empowerment approach allows the health professional to define the needs and make decisions for the client.
questions.explanation: False. Empowerment enables clients/communities to define their OWN needs and make their OWN decisions.
questions.hint: Empowerment means giving power, not taking it.

questions.question: The Educational Approach focuses on three aspects: Cognitive, Affective, and ___?
questions.explanation: Bloom's taxonomy in education includes Cognitive (knowledge), Affective (attitude), and Behavioral/Psychomotor (skills).

questions.question: Which approach focuses on preventing the progression of disease through early detection (e.g., breast self-exam)?
questions.explanation: Secondary prevention aims at early detection and treatment to prevent progression.
questions.hint: It's the second level of the medical approach.

questions.question: One outcome of the educational approach is 'Health Literacy'. What does this mean?

options.text: Ability to access, understand, and use information to promote health

questions.explanation: Health literacy is the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health info needed to make appropriate decisions.

questions.question: The Societal Change approach regards health as a human right.
questions.explanation: True. It views health as a political and social process and a fundamental right.
